statement: B. Stadium and Gamestime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutDaniel is organizing a football tournament. He has come up with the following tournament format:In the first several (possibly zero) stages, while the number of teams is even, they split in pairs and play one game for each pair. At each stage the loser of each pair is eliminated (there are no draws). Such stages are held while the number of teams is even.Eventually there will be an odd number of teams remaining. If there is one team remaining, it will be declared the winner, and the tournament ends. Otherwise each of the remaining teams will play with each other remaining team once in round robin tournament (if there arexteams, there will begames), and the tournament ends.For example, if there were 20 teams initially, they would begin by playing 10 games. So, 10 teams would be eliminated, and the remaining 10 would play 5 games. Then the remaining 5 teams would play 10 games in a round robin tournament. In total there would be 10+5+10=25 games.Daniel has already booked the stadium forngames. Help him to determine how many teams he should invite so that the tournament needsexactlyngames. processed.result:
You are given an integer $n$ representing the total number of games to be played in a football tournament.  The tournament follows these rules:

1. Teams are paired up and play games until the number of teams is odd.
2.  If there is one team left, they win.
3. If there are multiple teams left, they play a round-robin tournament (each team plays every other team once).

Determine all the possible numbers of teams that could result in exactly $n$ games being played. If no such number of teams exists, output -1.

Given a number of games, find all possible numbers of teams that could play those games in a specific tournament format. The format involves pairing teams until there is an odd number remaining, then having them play a round-robin tournament.
